See also: Other events of 1987
List of years in Germany

Events in the year 1987 in Germany.

Contents

  • 1 Incumbents
  • 2 Events
  • 3 Births
  • 4 Deaths
  • 5 See also
  • 6 References

Incumbents[edit]

  • President - Richard von Weizsäcker
  • Chancellor – Helmut Kohl

Events[edit]

  • 25 January - West German federal election, 1987
  • 20 February - 3 March - 37th Berlin International Film Festival
  • 12 March - The third cabinet Kohl led by Helmut Kohl was sworn in.
  • 26 March - Germany in the Eurovision Song Contest 1987
  • 17 May - Rhineland-Palatinate state election, 1987
  • 12 June - 20 September - documenta 8
  • 12 June - Tear down this wall! in Berlin
  • September - Olof Palme Peace March
  • Date unknown: German coompany Mannesmann acquired German company ZF Sachs.

Births[edit]

  • February 9 - Magdalena Neuner, German professional biathlete. She is the most successful woman of all time at Biathlon World Championships
  • April 4 - Sami Khedira, German footballer
  • April 20
    • Thorsten Kirschbaum, German footballer
    • Michael Klauß, German footballer
  • April 29 - Christian Reitz, German sport shooter
  • June 18 - Vanessa Hegelmaier, German model
  • September 18 - Johanna Uekermann, German politician
  • October 25 - Fabian Hambüchen, German gymnast
  • December 11 - Peter Scholze, German mathematician

Deaths[edit]

  • February 1 - Gustav Knuth, German actor (born 1901)
  • February 8 - Max Seydewitz, German politician (born 1892)
  • February 10 - Hans Rosenthal, German teleivion presenter (born 1925)
  • March 13 - Bernhard Grzimek, German zoo director, zoologist, book author, editor, and animal conservationist in postwar West-Germany (born 1909)
  • March 26 - Eugen Jochum, German conductor (born 1902)
  • May 8 - Carl Tchilinghiryan, German businessman (born 1910)
  • July 7 - Hannelore Schroth, German actress (born 1922)
  • August 26 - Georg Wittig, German chemist, Nobel Prize in Chemistry laureate (born 1897)
  • September 5 - Wolfgang Fortner, German composer (born 1907)
  • October 16 - Joseph Höffner, German cardinal of the Roman Catholic Church (born 1906)
  • November 28 - Wolfgang Liebeneiner, German actor and film director (born 1905)
  • December 9 - Prince Ernest Augustus of Hanover (born 1914)
  • December 18 - Conny Plank, German musician (born 1940)
  • December 22 - Gustav Fröhlich, German actor (born 1902)
  • December 31 - Wolfgang Zeidler, German judge (born 1924)

See also[edit]

  • 1987 in German television
